text: Jean-Bédel Bokassa (; 22 February 1921 – 3 November 1996), also known as Bokassa I, was a Central African political and military leader. He was the second president of the Central African Republic and as the emperor of the Central African Empire, from his Saint-Sylvestre coup d'état on 1 January 1966 until overthrown in a coup in 1979. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Former dictators Category:Presidents of the Central Africa Republic
title: Jean-Bédel Bokassa
